title: Lemon Garlic Salmon
description: Flaky salmon baked with lemon, garlic, and herbs for a bright weeknight dinner. I NEED A LOGNER TEXT TO TEST OUT THE FUNCTION OF THE RECIPE CARDS. LOREM20
instructions:
1. Line a baking sheet and place salmon skin-side down.
2. Mix olive oil, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
3. Brush mixture over salmon.
4. Bake 12–15 minutes until flaky.
5. Garnish with parsley and serve.
tipsAndTricks:
Don’t overbake—pull salmon at 125–130°F internal temp.
Broil 1–2 minutes at the end for light browning.
moreInfo: Serve with roasted veggies or rice. Great for meal prep.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: Colorful veggies tossed in a simple soy-garlic sauce; quick, flexible, and healthy.
miceEnPlace: Slice bell pepper, onion, and carrot.
Whisk soy sauce, honey, vinegar, cornstarch, and water.
instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok on high.
2. Stir-fry broccoli, carrot, onion, and pepper 4–6 minutes.
3. Add garlic and ginger; cook 30 seconds.
4. Pour in sauce; toss until glossy and thickened.
5. Season to taste and serve over rice.
tipsAndTricks:
Cook in batches to avoid steaming.
Add tofu or chicken for extra protein.
moreInfo: Swap any veggies you like—snow peas, mushrooms, or zucchini are great.

title: Margherita Pizza
description: Classic thin-crust pizza with tomato, mozzarella, and fresh basil.
miceEnPlace: Preheat oven to 500°F (260°C) with stone or steel.
instructions:
1. Stretch dough on floured surface.
2. Spread tomatoes thinly; drizzle olive oil.
3. Add mozzarella; season lightly.
4. Bake 8–12 minutes until crust is blistered.
5. Top with basil and serve immediately.
tipsAndTricks:
Less sauce prevents sogginess.
Bake on a preheated stone for best crispness.
moreInfo: Finish with a drizzle of good olive oil.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Tender chicken in a creamy, spiced tomato sauce; a takeout favorite at home.
miceEnPlace: Mince garlic and ginger; dice onion.
Mix yogurt, lemon juice, and spices for marinade.
instructions:
1. Marinate chicken 15–30 minutes.
2. Sear chicken in butter until lightly browned; remove.
3. Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger.
4. Add tomato sauce and spices; simmer 10 minutes.
5. Return chicken, stir in cream; simmer 10–15 minutes.
6. Season and garnish with cilantro.
tipsAndTricks: Broil marinated chicken for char before adding to sauce.
moreInfo: Serve with basmati rice and naan.

title: Shrimp Scampi
description: Garlicky shrimp tossed with butter, lemon, and pasta for a quick, elegant meal.
instructions:
1. Cook pasta; reserve 1/2 c pasta water.
2. Sauté garlic and red pepper in olive oil and butter.
3. Add shrimp; cook 1–2 minutes per side.
4. Add lemon juice and pasta water; toss with pasta.
5. Season and garnish with parsley.
tipsAndTricks: Don’t overcook shrimp—pull when just opaque.
moreInfo: Great with a side salad or crusty bread.

title: Beef Stroganoff
description: Tender beef and mushrooms in a creamy sauce served over egg noodles.
instructions:
1. Cook noodles; set aside.
2. Sear beef quickly; remove.
3. Sauté onion and mushrooms in butter; add garlic.
4. Stir in broth and mustard; simmer 5 minutes.
5. Return beef; off heat stir in sour cream.
6. Season and serve over noodles.
tipsAndTricks: Add sour cream off heat to avoid curdling.
moreInfo: Garnish with parsley for freshness.

title: Butternut Squash Soup
description: Silky, slightly sweet squash soup with warm spices.
miceEnPlace: Peel and cube squash (or use pre-cut).
If using, peel and dice apple.
instructions:
1. Sauté onion in butter until soft.
2. Add squash (and apple), spices, and broth.
3. Simmer 20–25 minutes until tender.
4. Blend until smooth; add cream if desired.
5. Season to taste.
tipsAndTricks: Roast squash first for deeper flavor.
moreInfo: Top with pumpkin seeds or a swirl of cream.

title: Thai Green Curry
description: Fragrant coconut curry with chicken and vegetables.
instructions:
1. Sauté curry paste in a little oil 30 seconds.
2. Add coconut milk and broth; bring to simmer.
3. Add chicken; cook 10–12 minutes.
4. Add vegetables; simmer 5 minutes.
5. Season with fish sauce and sugar; top with basil.
6. Serve with jasmine rice.
tipsAndTricks: Adjust heat with more or less curry paste.
moreInfo: To make vegetarian, swap tofu and veg broth.

title: BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwiches
description: Slow-cooked pork shoulder shredded and tossed with tangy BBQ sauce.
miceEnPlace: Trim excess fat from pork shoulder.
instructions:
1. Place onions in slow cooker; add pork and seasonings.
2. Pour broth; cook on LOW 7–8 hours.
3. Shred pork; toss with BBQ sauce.
4. Serve on buns.
tipsAndTricks: Finish under broiler for crispy edges.
moreInfo: Top with coleslaw for crunch.

title: Greek Chicken Salad
description: Crisp salad with lemon-herb chicken, cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, and feta.
miceEnPlace: Season chicken with salt, pepper, and oregano.
Whisk lemon juice and olive oil.
instructions:
1. Grill or pan-cook chicken 6–7 min/side; rest and slice.
2. Toss lettuce, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and olives.
3. Dress with lemon-olive oil.
4. Top with chicken and feta.
tipsAndTricks: Add pita chips for crunch.
moreInfo: Great as a meal prep lunch.

title: Fluffy Pancakes
description: Classic, light pancakes perfect for weekend breakfasts.
instructions:
1. Combine wet and dry until just mixed.
2. Pour 1/4 c batter per pancake.
3. Flip when bubbles form; cook until golden.
4. Serve with syrup.
tipsAndTricks: Don’t overmix for tender pancakes.
moreInfo: Add blueberries or chocolate chips if desired.

title: Avocado Toast with Egg
description: Toasted bread topped with creamy avocado and a soft-cooked egg.
miceEnPlace: Mash avocado with lemon, salt, and pepper.
instructions:
1. Spread avocado on toast.
2. Top with egg.
3. Season and add chili flakes if using.
tipsAndTricks: Use a squeeze of lemon to prevent browning.
moreInfo: Great with everything bagel seasoning.

title: Baked Ziti
description: Cheesy baked pasta with marinara and ricotta—crowd pleaser!
miceEnPlace: Mix ricotta with salt and pepper.
instructions:
1. Toss pasta with marinara and ricotta.
2. Transfer to dish; top with mozzarella and Parmesan.
3. Bake 20–25 minutes until bubbly.
4. Rest 5 minutes and serve.
tipsAndTricks: Broil briefly for a browned top.
moreInfo: Add cooked sausage for extra protein.

title: Teriyaki Chicken Bowls
description: Sweet-savory teriyaki chicken served over rice with steamed veggies.
miceEnPlace: Whisk soy, sugar, honey, vinegar, ginger, and garlic.
instructions:
1. Sear chicken until cooked.
2. Add sauce; simmer 2–3 minutes.
3. Stir in cornstarch slurry; thicken.
4. Serve over rice with broccoli.
tipsAndTricks: Toast sesame seeds for garnish.
moreInfo: Swap chicken for tofu for a vegetarian bowl.

title: Turkey Meatballs
description: Lean turkey meatballs baked and simmered in marinara.
instructions:
1. Form 1–1.5" meatballs.
2. Bake 15–18 minutes until cooked.
3. Simmer in marinara 10 minutes.
4. Serve over pasta or in subs.
tipsAndTricks: Don’t overwork the meat for tenderness.
moreInfo: Add chopped parsley for freshness.

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: Creamy arborio rice slowly cooked with broth and sautéed mushrooms.
ingredients: 4 c Chicken or Veg Broth, warm
instructions:
1. Sauté onion in butter and oil.
2. Add rice; toast 1–2 minutes.
3. Deglaze with wine (optional).
4. Add warm broth 1 ladle at a time, stirring until absorbed.
5. Sauté mushrooms separately; fold in.
6. Finish with Parmesan; season.
tipsAndTricks: Stir frequently to release starch for creaminess.
moreInfo: Top with chives or truffle oil for luxury.

title: Fish Tacos
description: Crispy or grilled white fish tucked in tortillas with slaw and lime crema.
miceEnPlace: Mix lime crema (sour cream + lime juice).
Season fish with chili, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Prep slaw with cabbage, onion, cilantro.
instructions:
1. Cook fish in lightly oiled skillet 2–3 minutes/side.
2. Warm tortillas.
3. Assemble with fish, slaw, and crema.
4. Serve with lime wedges.
tipsAndTricks: Add avocado slices for richness.
moreInfo: Great grilled during summer.

title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Bell peppers stuffed with beef, rice, and cheese baked until tender.
instructions:
1. Sauté beef with onion and garlic; season.
2. Mix in rice and half the tomato sauce.
3. Fill peppers; top with remaining sauce.
4. Cover and bake 30 minutes; uncover, add cheese, bake 10–15 more.
tipsAndTricks: Parboil peppers 3 minutes for softer texture.
moreInfo: Use turkey or lentils for lighter/veg version.

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Silky pasta with eggs, Pecorino, and crisp pancetta—no cream needed.
miceEnPlace: Beat eggs with cheese and pepper.
instructions:
1. Cook pancetta until crisp; keep fat.
2. Cook spaghetti; reserve 1 c pasta water.
3. Toss hot pasta with pancetta and fat; off heat add egg mixture.
4. Stir vigorously, adding pasta water to create a silky sauce.
5. Season and serve immediately.
tipsAndTricks: Work off heat to avoid scrambling eggs.
moreInfo: Use lots of pepper for authentic flavor.

title: Chicken Fajitas
description: Sizzling strips of chicken with peppers and onions, served with warm tortillas.
miceEnPlace: Toss chicken with seasoning and oil.
instructions:
1. Sear chicken until cooked; remove.
2. Cook peppers and onion until tender-crisp.
3. Return chicken; toss together.
4. Serve with tortillas and lime.
tipsAndTricks: Cast iron gives the best char.
moreInfo: Top with sour cream or guacamole.

title: Caprese Pasta Salad
description: Chilled pasta with tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and balsamic dressing.
miceEnPlace: Boil pasta and cool under cold water.
instructions:
1. Toss pasta, tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
2. Dress with olive oil and balsamic.
3. Season to taste and chill.
tipsAndTricks: Add diced salami for extra savoriness.
moreInfo: Great make-ahead picnic dish.

title: Garlic Butter Green Beans
description: Quick sautéed green beans glossed with garlic butter—simple side dish.
instructions:
1. Blanch beans 2 minutes; drain.
2. Sauté butter and garlic; add beans.
3. Toss 2–3 minutes; season and serve.
tipsAndTricks: Finish with lemon for brightness.
moreInfo: Toast sliced almonds for crunch.

title: Sheet Pan Sausage & Veggies
description: Roasted sausage with mixed vegetables for an easy one-pan meal.
instructions:
1. Toss sausage and veggies with oil and seasoning.
2. Spread on sheet pan.
3. Roast 25–30 minutes, tossing once.
4. Serve hot.
tipsAndTricks: Cut veggies uniform for even roasting.
moreInfo: Great with a drizzle of balsamic glaze.

title: Creamy Tomato Basil Soup
description: Smooth tomato soup enriched with cream and fresh basil.
instructions:
1. Sauté onion in butter; add garlic.
2. Add tomatoes and broth; simmer 15 minutes.
3. Blend until smooth; stir in cream and basil.
4. Season and serve.
tipsAndTricks: Roasted tomatoes deepen flavor.
moreInfo: Serve with grilled cheese.

title: Garlic Herb Roasted Chicken
description: Whole chicken roasted with garlic, lemon, and herbs—crisp skin, juicy meat.
miceEnPlace: Mix butter with garlic and herbs.
instructions:
1. Rub chicken with herb butter; season well.
2. Place lemon in cavity.
3. Roast 55–65 minutes until 165°F.
4. Rest 10 minutes before carving.
tipsAndTricks:
Dry skin = crispier roast.
Roast over veggies to make a side.
moreInfo: Pan drippings make great gravy.

title: Cajun Shrimp & Grits
description: Creamy grits topped with spicy shrimp and a buttery pan sauce.
instructions:
1. Cook grits in water/broth; stir in cheese.
2. Sauté shrimp in butter 1–2 minutes/side.
3. Add garlic and lemon; toss.
4. Spoon shrimp over grits and serve.
tipsAndTricks: Finish grits with a knob of butter for gloss.
moreInfo: Top with scallions or crispy bacon bits.

title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Chewy edges, soft centers, and plenty of chocolate chips.
instructions:
1. Mix sugars with butter; add egg and vanilla.
2. Fold in dry ingredients, then chips.
3. Scoop onto sheet; bake 10–12 minutes.
4. Cool on rack.
tipsAndTricks: Chill dough 30 minutes for thicker cookies.
moreInfo: Sprinkle flaky salt on top for contrast.
